Name: The Message
Credit: Dir: Moustapha Akkad With: Anthony Quinn, Irene Papas, Michael Ansara
Outline: This must-see epic depicts the birth of Islam. In the 7th century Mohammed is visited by Angel Gabriel...

Name: Life Is Beautiful
Credit: Dir: Roberto Benigni With: Roberto Benigni, Nicoletta Braschi, Giorgio Cantarini
Outline: When an open-minded Jewish librarian and his son become victims of the Holocaust, he uses a perfect mixture of will, humor and imagination to protect his son from the dangers around their camp.

Name: Saving Private Ryan
Credit: Dir: Steven Spielberg With: Tom Hanks, Matt Damon, Tom Sizemore
Outline: Following the Normandy Landings, a group of U.S. soldiers go behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action.

Name: Casablanca
Credit: Dir: Michael Curtiz With: Humphrey Bogart, Ingrid Bergman, Paul Henreid
Outline: In Casablanca, Morocco during the early days of World War II, an American expatriate meets a former lover, with unforeseen complications.

Name: Baahubali: The Beginning
Credit: Dir: S.S. Rajamouli With: Prabhas, Rana Daggubati, Anushka Shetty
Outline: In ancient India, an adventurous and daring man becomes involved in a decades old feud between two warring people.

Name: The Pianist
Credit: Dir: Roman Polanski With: Adrien Brody, Thomas Kretschmann, Frank Finlay
Outline: A Polish Jewish musician struggles to survive the destruction of the Warsaw ghetto of World War II.

Name: Apocalypse Now
Credit: Dir: Francis Ford Coppola With: Martin Sheen, Marlon Brando, Robert Duvall
Outline: During the Vietnam War, Captain Willard is sent on a dangerous mission into Cambodia to assassinate a renegade colonel who has set himself up as a god among a local tribe.

Name: The Great Dictator
Credit: Dir: Charles Chaplin With: Charles Chaplin, Paulette Goddard, Jack Oakie
Outline: Dictator Adenoid Hynkel tries to expand his empire while a poor Jewish barber tries to avoid persecution from Hynkel's regime.

Name: Grave of the Fireflies
Credit: Dir: Isao Takahata With: Tsutomu Tatsumi, Ayano Shiraishi, Akemi Yamaguchi
Outline: A tragic film covering a young boy and his little sister's struggle to survive in Japan during World War II.

Name: Paths of Glory
Credit: Dir: Stanley Kubrick With: Kirk Douglas, Ralph Meeker, Adolphe Menjou
Outline: After refusing to attack an enemy position, a general accuses the soldiers of cowardice and their commanding officer must defend them.

Name: Das Boot
Credit: Dir: Wolfgang Petersen With: JÃ¼rgen Prochnow, Herbert GrÃ¶nemeyer, Klaus Wennemann
Outline: The claustrophobic world of a WWII German U-boat; boredom, filth, and sheer terror.

Name: Braveheart
Credit: Dir: Mel Gibson With: Mel Gibson, Sophie Marceau, Patrick McGoohan
Outline: When his secret bride is executed for assaulting an English soldier who tried to rape her, William Wallace begins a revolt against King Edward I of England.

Name: Lawrence of Arabia
Credit: Dir: David Lean With: Peter O'Toole, Alec Guinness, Anthony Quinn
Outline: The story of TE Lawrence, the English officer who successfully united and lead the diverse, often warring, Arab tribes during World War 1 in order to fight the Turks.

Name: Full Metal Jacket
Credit: Dir: Stanley Kubrick With: Matthew Modine, R. Lee Ermey, Vincent D'Onofrio
Outline: A pragmatic U.S. Marine observes the dehumanizing effects the Vietnam War has on his fellow recruits from their brutal boot camp training to the bloody street fighting in Hue.

Name: Inglourious Basterds
Credit: Dir: Quentin Tarantino With: Brad Pitt, Diane Kruger, Eli Roth
Outline: In Nazi-occupied France during World War II, a plan to assassinate Nazi leaders by a group of Jewish U.S. soldiers coincides with a theatre owner's vengeful plans for the same.

Name: Downfall
Credit: Dir: Oliver Hirschbiegel With: Bruno Ganz, Alexandra Maria Lara, Ulrich Matthes
Outline: Traudl Junge, the final secretary for Adolf Hitler, tells of the Nazi dictator's final days in his Berlin bunker at the end of WWII.

Name: The Great Escape
Credit: Dir: John Sturges With: Steve McQueen, James Garner, Richard Attenborough
Outline: Allied P.O.W.s plan for several hundred of their number to escape from a German camp during World War II.

Name: The General
Credit: Dir: Clyde Bruckman, Buster Keaton With: Buster Keaton, Marion Mack, Glen Cavender
Outline: When Union spies steal an engineer's beloved locomotive, he pursues it single-handedly and straight through enemy lines.

Name: Judgment at Nuremberg
Credit: Dir: Stanley Kramer With: Spencer Tracy, Burt Lancaster, Richard Widmark
Outline: In 1948, an American court in occupied Germany tries four Nazi judges for war crimes.

Name: Pan's Labyrinth
Credit: Dir: Guillermo del Toro With: Ivana Baquero, Ariadna Gil, Sergi LÃ³pez
Outline: In the falangist Spain of 1944, the bookish young stepdaughter of a sadistic army officer escapes into an eerie but captivating fantasy world.

Name: The Bridge on the River Kwai
Credit: Dir: David Lean With: William Holden, Alec Guinness, Jack Hawkins
Outline: After settling his differences with a Japanese PoW camp commander, a British colonel co-operates to oversee his men's construction of a railway bridge for their captors - while oblivious to a plan by the Allies to destroy it.

Name: Incendies
Credit: Dir: Denis Villeneuve With: Lubna Azabal, MÃ©lissa DÃ©sormeaux-Poulin, Maxim Gaudette
Outline: Twins journey to the Middle East to discover their family history, and fulfill their mother's last wishes.

Name: Gone with the Wind
Credit: Dir: Victor Fleming With: Clark Gable, Vivien Leigh, Thomas Mitchell
Outline: A manipulative Southern belle carries on a turbulent affair with a blockade runner during the American Civil War.

Name: The Deer Hunter
Credit: Dir: Michael Cimino With: Robert De Niro, Christopher Walken, John Cazale
Outline: An in-depth examination of the ways in which the U.S. Vietnam war impacts and disrupts the lives of people in a small industrial town in Pennsylvania.

Name: The Best Years of Our Lives
Credit: Dir: William Wyler With: Fredric March, Dana Andrews, Myrna Loy
Outline: Three World War II veterans return home to small-town America to discover that they and their families have been irreparably changed.

Name: Tae Guk Gi: The Brotherhood of War
Credit: Dir: Je-kyu Kang With: Dong-gun Jang, Bin Won, Eun-ju Lee
Outline: A drama about the fate of brothers forced to fight in the Korean War.

Name: La Grande Illusion
Credit: Dir: Jean Renoir With: Jean Gabin, Dita Parlo, Pierre Fresnay
Outline: During the first World War, two French soldiers are captured and imprisoned in a German P.O.W. camp. Several escape attempts follow until they are sent to a seemingly impenetrable fortress which seems impossible to escape from.

Name: Hotel Rwanda
Credit: Dir: Terry George With: Don Cheadle, Sophie Okonedo, Joaquin Phoenix
Outline: The true story of Paul Rusesabagina, a hotel manager who housed over a thousand Tutsi refugees during their struggle against the Hutu militia in Rwanda.

Name: The Battle of Algiers
Credit: Dir: Gillo Pontecorvo With: Brahim Hadjadj, Jean Martin, Yacef Saadi
Outline: In the 1950s, fear and violence escalate as the people of Algiers fight for independence from the French government.

Name: Underground
Credit: Dir: Emir Kusturica With: Predrag Manojlovic, Lazar Ristovski, Mirjana Jokovic
Outline: The story follows an underground weapons manufacturer in Belgrade during WWII and evolves into fairly surreal situations...

Name: Platoon
Credit: Dir: Oliver Stone With: Charlie Sheen, Tom Berenger, Willem Dafoe
Outline: A young recruit in Vietnam faces a moral crisis when confronted with the horrors of war and the duality of man.

Name: Ben-Hur
Credit: Dir: William Wyler With: Charlton Heston, Jack Hawkins, Stephen Boyd
Outline: When a Jewish prince is betrayed and sent into slavery by a Roman friend, he regains his freedom and comes back for revenge.

Name: Barry Lyndon
Credit: Dir: Stanley Kubrick With: Ryan O'Neal, Marisa Berenson, Patrick Magee
Outline: An Irish rogue wins the heart of a rich widow and assumes her dead husband's aristocratic position in 18th-century England.

Name: The Imitation Game
Credit: Dir: Morten Tyldum With: Benedict Cumberbatch, Keira Knightley, Matthew Goode
Outline: During World War II, mathematician Alan Turing tries to crack the enigma code with help from fellow mathematicians.

Name: Stalag 17
Credit: Dir: Billy Wilder With: William Holden, Don Taylor, Otto Preminger
Outline: When two escaping American World War II prisoners are killed, the German POW camp barracks black marketeer, J.J. Sefton, is suspected of being an informer.

Name: All Quiet on the Western Front
Credit: Dir: Lewis Milestone With: Lew Ayres, Louis Wolheim, John Wray
Outline: A young soldier faces profound disillusionment in the soul-destroying horror of World War I.

Name: Persepolis
Credit: Dir: Vincent Paronnaud, Marjane Satrapi With: Chiara Mastroianni, Catherine Deneuve, Gena Rowlands
Outline: A precocious and outspoken Iranian girl grows up during the Islamic Revolution.

Name: Patton
Credit: Dir: Franklin J. Schaffner With: George C. Scott, Karl Malden, Stephen Young
Outline: The World War II phase of the career of the controversial American general, George S. Patton.

Name: Duck Soup
Credit: Dir: Leo McCarey With: Groucho Marx, Harpo Marx, Chico Marx
Outline: Rufus T. Firefly is named president/dictator of bankrupt Freedonia and declares war on neighboring Sylvania over the love of wealthy Mrs. Teasdale.

Name: Waltz with Bashir
Credit: Dir: Ari Folman With: Ari Folman, Ron Ben-Yishai, Ronny Dayag
Outline: An Israeli film director interviews fellow veterans of the 1982 invasion of Lebanon to reconstruct his own memories of his term of service in that conflict.

Name: Doctor Zhivago
Credit: Dir: David Lean With: Omar Sharif, Julie Christie, Geraldine Chaplin
Outline: The life of a Russian physician and poet who, although married to another, falls in love with a political activist's wife and experiences hardship during the First World War and then the October Revolution.

Name: Battleship Potemkin
Credit: Dir: Sergei M. Eisenstein With: Aleksandr Antonov, Vladimir Barsky, Grigori Aleksandrov
Outline: A dramatized account of a great Russian naval mutiny and a resulting street demonstration which brought on a police massacre.

Name: No Man's Land
Credit: Dir: Danis Tanovic With: Branko Djuric, Rene Bitorajac, Filip Sovagovic
Outline: Bosnia and Herzegovina during 1993 at the time of the heaviest fighting between the two warring sides. Two soldiers from opposing sides in the conflict, Nino and Ciki, become trapped in no man's land, whilst a third soldier becomes a living booby trap.

Name: Spartacus
Credit: Dir: Stanley Kubrick With: Kirk Douglas, Laurence Olivier, Jean Simmons
Outline: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.

Name: Letters from Iwo Jima
Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Ken Watanabe, Kazunari Ninomiya, Tsuyoshi Ihara
Outline: The story of the battle of Iwo Jima between the United States and Imperial Japan during World War II, as told from the perspective of the Japanese who fought it.

Name: Glory
Credit: Dir: Edward Zwick With: Matthew Broderick, Denzel Washington, Cary Elwes
Outline: Robert Gould Shaw leads the US Civil War's first all-black volunteer company, fighting prejudices of both his own Union army and the Confederates.

Name: The African Queen
Credit: Dir: John Huston With: Humphrey Bogart, Katharine Hepburn, Robert Morley
Outline: In Africa during WWI, a gin-swilling riverboat captain is persuaded by a strait-laced missionary to use his boat to attack an enemy warship.

Name: The Killing Fields
Credit: Dir: Roland JoffÃ© With: Sam Waterston, Haing S. Ngor, John Malkovich
Outline: A photographer is trapped in Cambodia during tyrant Pol Pot's bloody "Year Zero" cleansing campaign, which claimed the lives of two million "undesirable" civilians.

Name: Black Book
Credit: Dir: Paul Verhoeven With: Carice van Houten, Sebastian Koch, Thom Hoffman
Outline: In the Nazi-occupied Netherlands during World War II, a Jewish singer infiltrates the regional Gestapo headquarters for the Dutch resistance.

Name: Beasts of No Nation
Credit: Dir: Cary Joji Fukunaga With: Abraham Attah, Emmanuel Affadzi, Ricky Adelayitor
Outline: A drama based on the experiences of Agu, a child soldier fighting in the civil war of an unnamed African country.

Name: Unbroken
Credit: Dir: Angelina Jolie With: Jack O'Connell, Miyavi, Domhnall Gleeson
Outline: After a near-fatal plane crash in WWII, Olympian Louis Zamperini spends a harrowing 47 days in a raft with two fellow crewmen before he's caught by the Japanese navy and sent to a prisoner-of-war camp.

Credit: Dir: Yann Demange With: Jack O'Connell, Sam Reid, Sean Harris
Outline: In 1971, a young and disorientated British soldier is accidentally abandoned by his unit following a riot on the deadly streets of Belfast.

Name: The Messenger
Credit: Dir: Oren Moverman With: Ben Foster, Samantha Morton, Woody Harrelson
Outline: An American soldier struggles with an ethical dilemma when he becomes involved with a widow of a fallen officer.

Name: Three Kings
Credit: Dir: David O. Russell With: George Clooney, Mark Wahlberg, Ice Cube
Outline: In the aftermath of the Persian Gulf War, 4 soldiers set out to steal gold that was stolen from Kuwait, but they discover people who desperately need their help.

Name: We Were Soldiers
Credit: Dir: Randall Wallace With: Mel Gibson, Madeleine Stowe, Greg Kinnear
Outline: The story of the first major battle of the American phase of the Vietnam War and the soldiers on both sides that fought it.

Name: The Patriot
Credit: Dir: Roland Emmerich With: Mel Gibson, Heath Ledger, Joely Richardson
Outline: Peaceful farmer Benjamin Martin is driven to lead the Colonial Militia during the American Revolution when a sadistic British officer murders his son.

Name: Valkyrie
Credit: Dir: Bryan Singer With: Tom Cruise, Bill Nighy, Carice van Houten
Outline: A dramatization of the 20 July assassination and political coup plot by desperate renegade German Army officers against Hitler during World War II.

Name: The Water Diviner
Credit: Dir: Russell Crowe With: Russell Crowe, Olga Kurylenko, Jai Courtney
Outline: An Australian man travels to Turkey after the Battle of Gallipoli to try and locate his three missing sons.

Name: The Railway Man
Credit: Dir: Jonathan Teplitzky With: Colin Firth, Nicole Kidman, Stellan SkarsgÃ¥rd
Outline: A former British Army officer, who was tormented as a prisoner of war at a Japanese labor camp during World War II, discovers that the man responsible for much of his treatment is still alive and sets out to confront him.

Name: Flags of Our Fathers
Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Ryan Phillippe, Barry Pepper, Joseph Cross
Outline: The life stories of the six men who raised the flag at The Battle of Iwo Jima, a turning point in WWII.

Name: Rambo
Credit: Dir: Sylvester Stallone With: Sylvester Stallone, Julie Benz, Matthew Marsden
Outline: In Thailand, John Rambo joins a group of mercenaries to venture into war-torn Burma, and rescue a group of Christian aid workers who were kidnapped by the ruthless local infantry unit.

Name: Casualties of War
Credit: Dir: Brian De Palma With: Michael J. Fox, Sean Penn, Don Harvey
Outline: During the Vietnam War, a soldier finds himself the outsider of his own squad when they unnecessarily kidnap a female villager.

Name: Jarhead
Credit: Dir: Sam Mendes With: Jake Gyllenhaal, Jamie Foxx, Lucas Black
Outline: A psychological study of operations desert shield and desert storm during the gulf war; through the eyes of a U.S marine sniper who struggles to cope with the possibility his girlfriend may be cheating on him back home.

Name: Tigerland
Credit: Dir: Joel Schumacher With: Colin Farrell, Matthew Davis, Clifton Collins Jr.
Outline: A group of recruits go through Advanced Infantry Training at Fort Polk, Louisiana's infamous Tigerland, last stop before Vietnam for tens of thousands of young men in 1971.

Name: Seven Years in Tibet
Credit: Dir: Jean-Jacques Annaud With: Brad Pitt, David Thewlis, BD Wong
Outline: True story of Heinrich Harrer, an Austrian mountain climber who became friends with the Dalai Lama at the time of China's takeover of Tibet.

Name: Camp X-Ray
Credit: Dir: Peter Sattler With: Kristen Stewart, Peyman Moaadi, Lane Garrison
Outline: A soldier assigned to Guantanamo Bay befriends a man who has been imprisoned there.

Name: Stripes
Credit: Dir: Ivan Reitman With: Bill Murray, John Candy, Harold Ramis
Outline: Two friends who are dissatisfied with their jobs decide to join the army for a bit of fun.

Name: Che: Part Two
Credit: Dir: Steven Soderbergh With: DemiÃ¡n Bichir, Rodrigo Santoro, Benicio Del Toro
Outline: In 1967, Ernesto 'Che' Guevara leads a small partisan army to fight an ill-fated revolutionary guerrilla war in Bolivia, South America.

Name: Elizabeth: The Golden Age
Credit: Dir: Shekhar Kapur With: Cate Blanchett, Clive Owen, Geoffrey Rush
Outline: A mature Queen Elizabeth endures multiple crises late in her reign including court intrigues, an assassination plot, the Spanish Armada, and romantic disappointments.

Name: Macbeth
Credit: Dir: Justin Kurzel With: Michael Fassbender, Marion Cotillard, Jack Madigan
Outline: Macbeth, the Thane of Glamis, receives a prophecy from a trio of witches that one day he will become King of Scotland. Consumed by ambition and spurred to action by his wife, Macbeth murders his king and takes the throne for himself.

Name: Green Zone
Credit: Dir: Paul Greengrass With: Matt Damon, Jason Isaacs, Greg Kinnear
Outline: Discovering covert and faulty intelligence causes a U.S. Army officer to go rogue as he hunts for Weapons of Mass Destruction in an unstable region.

Name: Heartbreak Ridge
Credit: Dir: Clint Eastwood With: Clint Eastwood, Marsha Mason, Everett McGill
Outline: A hard-nosed, hard-living Marine gunnery sergeant clashes with his superiors and his ex-wife as he takes command of a spoiled recon platoon with a bad attitude.

Name: K-19: The Widowmaker
Credit: Dir: Kathryn Bigelow With: Harrison Ford, Sam Spruell, Peter Stebbings
Outline: When Russia's first nuclear submarine malfunctions on its maiden voyage, the crew must race to save the ship and prevent a nuclear disaster.

Name: Tears of the Sun
Credit: Dir: Antoine Fuqua With: Bruce Willis, Cole Hauser, Monica Bellucci
Outline: A Special-Ops commander leads his team into the Nigerian jungle in order to rescue a doctor who will only join them if they agree to save 70 refugees too.

Name: Courage Under Fire
Credit: Dir: Edward Zwick With: Denzel Washington, Meg Ryan, Lou Diamond Phillips
Outline: A US Army officer, despondent about a deadly mistake he made, investigates a female chopper commander's worthiness for the Medal of Honor.

Name: Australia
Credit: Dir: Baz Luhrmann With: Nicole Kidman, Hugh Jackman, Shea Adams
Outline: Set in northern Australia before World War II, an English aristocrat who inherits a sprawling ranch reluctantly pacts with a stock-man in order to protect her new property from a takeover plot. As the pair drive 2,000 head of cattle over unforgiving landscape, they experience the bombing of Darwin, Australia, by Japanese forces firsthand.

Name: U-571
Credit: Dir: Jonathan Mostow With: Matthew McConaughey, Bill Paxton, Harvey Keitel
Outline: A German submarine is boarded by disguised American submariners trying to capture their Enigma cipher machine.

Name: Flyboys
Genre: Action | Adventure | Drama | History | Romance | War
Credit: Dir: Tony Bill With: James Franco, Jean Reno, Jennifer Decker
Outline: The adventures of the Lafayette Escadrille, young Americans who volunteered for the French military before the U.S. entered World War I, and became the country's first fighter pilots.

Name: Act of Valor
Credit: Dir: Mike McCoy, Scott Waugh With: Alex Veadov, Roselyn Sanchez, Nestor Serrano
Outline: An elite team of Navy SEALs embark on a covert mission to recover a kidnapped CIA agent.

Name: The Four Feathers
Credit: Dir: Shekhar Kapur With: Heath Ledger, Wes Bentley, Kate Hudson
Outline: A British officer resigns his post just before battle and subsequently receives four white feathers from his friends and fiancee as symbols of what they believe to be his cowardice.

Name: Rambo: First Blood Part II
Credit: Dir: George P. Cosmatos With: Sylvester Stallone, Richard Crenna, Charles Napier
Outline: John Rambo is released from prison by the government for a top-secret covert mission to the last place on Earth he'd want to return - the jungles of Vietnam.

Name: The Messenger: The Story of Joan of Arc
Credit: Dir: Luc Besson With: Milla Jovovich, John Malkovich, Rab Affleck
Outline: A young girl receives a vision that drives her to rid France of its oppressors.

Name: Behind Enemy Lines
Credit: Dir: John Moore With: Gene Hackman, Owen Wilson, Gabriel Macht
Outline: A Navy navigator is shot down over enemy territory and is ruthlessly pursued by a secret police enforcer and the opposing troops. Meanwhile his commanding officer goes against orders in an attempt to rescue him.

Name: Centurion
Genre: Action | Adventure | Drama | History | Thriller | War
Credit: Dir: Neil Marshall With: Michael Fassbender, Dominic West, Olga Kurylenko
Outline: A splinter group of Roman soldiers fight for their lives behind enemy lines after their legion is decimated in a devastating guerrilla attack.

Name: Rules of Engagement
Credit: Dir: William Friedkin With: Tommy Lee Jones, Samuel L. Jackson, Guy Pearce
Outline: An attorney defends an officer on trial for ordering his troops to fire on civilians after they stormed a U.S. embassy in a third world country.

Name: Dear John
Credit: Dir: Lasse HallstrÃ¶m With: Channing Tatum, Amanda Seyfried, Richard Jenkins
Outline: A romantic drama about a soldier who falls for a conservative college student while he's home on leave.

Name: Hart's War
Credit: Dir: Gregory Hoblit With: Bruce Willis, Colin Farrell, Terrence Howard
Outline: A law student becomes a lieutenant during World War II, is captured and asked to defend a black prisoner of war falsely accused of murder.

Name: King Arthur
Credit: Dir: Antoine Fuqua With: Clive Owen, Stephen Dillane, Keira Knightley
Outline: A demystified take on the tale of King Arthur and the Knights of the Round Table.

Name: Dracula Untold
Credit: Dir: Gary Shore With: Luke Evans, Dominic Cooper, Sarah Gadon
Outline: As his kingdom is being threatened by the Turks, young prince Vlad Tepes must become a monster feared by his own people in order to obtain the power needed to protect his own family, and the families of his kingdom.

Name: 300: Rise of an Empire
Credit: Dir: Noam Murro With: Sullivan Stapleton, Eva Green, Lena Headey
Outline: Greek general Themistokles leads the charge against invading Persian forces led by mortal-turned-god Xerxes and Artemisia, vengeful commander of the Persian navy.

Name: The Men Who Stare at Goats
Credit: Dir: Grant Heslov With: Ewan McGregor, George Clooney, Kevin Spacey
Outline: A reporter in Iraq might just have the story of a lifetime when he meets Lyn Cassady, a guy who claims to be a former member of the U.S. Army's New Earth Army, a unit that employs paranormal powers in their missions.

Name: Lions for Lambs
Credit: Dir: Robert Redford With: Tom Cruise, Meryl Streep, Robert Redford
Outline: Injuries sustained by two Army rangers behind enemy lines in Afghanistan set off a sequence of events involving a congressman, a journalist and a professor.

Name: Coriolanus
Credit: Dir: Ralph Fiennes With: Ralph Fiennes, Gerard Butler, Brian Cox
Outline: A banished hero of Rome allies with a sworn enemy to take his revenge on the city.

Name: The Monuments Men
Credit: Dir: George Clooney With: George Clooney, Matt Damon, Bill Murray
Outline: An unlikely World War II platoon is tasked to rescue art masterpieces from Nazi thieves and return them to their owners.

Name: Pearl Harbor
Credit: Dir: Michael Bay With: Ben Affleck, Kate Beckinsale, Josh Hartnett
Outline: Pearl Harbor follows the story of two best friends, Rafe and Danny, and their love lives as they go off to join the war.

Name: Windtalkers
Credit: Dir: John Woo With: Nicolas Cage, Adam Beach, Peter Stormare
Outline: Two U.S. Marines in WWII are assigned to protect Navajo Marines who use their native language as an unbreakable radio cypher.

Name: Salò, or the 120 Days of Sodom
Credit: Dir: Pier Paolo Pasolini With: Paolo Bonacelli, Giorgio Cataldi, Umberto Paolo Quintavalle
Outline: Four fascist libertines round up nine adolescent boys and girls and subject them to a hundred and twenty days of physical, mental and sexual torture.

Name: Red Tails
Credit: Dir: Anthony Hemingway With: Cuba Gooding Jr., Gerald McRaney, David Oyelowo
Outline: A crew of African American pilots in the Tuskegee training program, having faced segregation while kept mostly on the ground during World War II, are called into duty under the guidance of Col. A.J. Bullard.

Name: Captain Corelli's Mandolin
Credit: Dir: John Madden With: Nicolas Cage, PenÃ©lope Cruz, John Hurt
Outline: When a fisherman leaves to fight with the Greek army during WWII, his fiancee falls in love with the local Italian commander.

Name: G.I. Jane
Credit: Dir: Ridley Scott With: Demi Moore, Viggo Mortensen, Anne Bancroft
Outline: A female Senator succeeds in enrolling a woman into Combined Reconnaissance Team training where everyone expects her to fail.
